results.title: Economic growth. 2. Policy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
Richard Bluck of Business Studies at Melbourne College of Advanced Education, dicusses economic growth in Australia, causes of Australian growth and implication for Government policies.

results.title: Economic growth. 1. Theory
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
Richard Bluck of Business Studies at Melbourne College of Advanced Education, discusses theories of economic growth covering concept and measurement, determinants and the costs and benefits of the effects.

results.title: Wages policy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
Ron Edwards of Melbourne College of Education talks to three prominent spokesmen offering differing views and policy perspectives on wages policy. Interviews with Andrew Hay (Confederation of Employers), John Halfpenny (Metal Workers Union), Kerry Klineberg (Chamber of Manufacturers).

results.title: Unemployment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
(HSC Economics series) Covers definitions of terms, general and specific causes and measurement of unvoluntary unemployment and the scenario relating to unemployment with productivity and demand. No other credits available.

results.title: Policy theories
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
Peter Joyce of Melbourne State College presents a detailed look at economic policy including Keynesian, Monetarist, Structuralist and Supply-side theories. For each theory he considers the cause of unemployment and the policy solution; the cause of inflation and the policy solution; conclusions and the major problems of the theory. No other credits.

results.title: Exchange rates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
Richard Bluck of Melbourne College of Advanced Education provides an overview of exchange rates. Highlights the background of the current ‘floating of the dollar’ showing alternatives and implications of the decision. Addresses fixed or floating exchange rates, definitions and mechanisms, problems of floating exchange rates, implications for public policy and management of the economy and the Australian experience.

results.title: Deregulation & monetary policy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
An examination of how monetary policy has operated in Australia in the 1980’s, presented by Richard Bluck of Melbourne College of Advanced Education. Covers how monetary policy operated in the old regulated financial sector and now under deregulation; review of major institutional and other changes; reasons for deregulation and its implications for macro-economic management of the Australian economy. Worksheets are included with the video.

results.title: Australian balance of payments
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
Richard Bluck of the School of Business Studies at Melbourne College of Advanced Education, presents this detailed examination of Australia’s Balance of Payments. Covers concepts involved: components of the Balance of Payments, recent trends and problems and implications for management of the economy.

results.title: Monetary policy: a macro-economic perspective
results.creator_credit: David Zweck, Anita Forsyth and Country Education Project
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
This program, produced in association with the Bank Education Service, discusses many controversial issues surrounding the relationship between the volume of money and the level of economic activity. Two professors of Economics, the chief economist of the ANZ Bank and the economics editor of the ‘Age’ debate these issues.

results.title: Industrial relations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
Ron Edwards of Melbourne College of Advanced Education interviews Simon Crean (ACTU), John Halfpenny (Australian Metalworkers Union), Kerry Klineberg (Chamber of Manufacturers) and Andrew Hay (Federation of Employers) on different ways of solving industrial relations problems.
